remarks: A variation on ~ prmind assuming complete induction for primes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
statement:
prmind.1 $e |- ( x = 1 -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
prmind.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
prmind.3 $e |- ( x = z -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
prmind.4 $e |- ( x = ( y x. z ) -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
prmind.5 $e |- ( x = A -> ( ph <-> et ) ) $.
prmind.6 $e |- ps $.
prmind2.7 $e |- ( ( x e. Prime /\ A. y e. ( 1 ... ( x - 1 ) ) ch ) -> ph ) $.
prmind2.8 $e |- ( ( y e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) /\ z e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) ) -> ( ( ch /\ th ) -> ta ) ) $.
prmind2 $p |- ( A e. NN -> et ) $.
$d A x $.
$d ch x z $.
$d et x $.
$d ph y z $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
$d x y z $.
